I have 540 chips and Villain has only 220 left behind. Both of us are now pot-committed.

My hand: 8♠ K♦ → Two-pair (8s & Kings)  
Board: 2♥ 8♦ 9♥ Q♠ → two pair on board Qs and 8s.

With his remaining 220 chips, P0 can’t deliver leverage; any bet he makes now will be an all-in or near all-in. My two-pair with the K-kicker is a very strong holding heads-up. Folding is out of the question; the situation is all about maximum value extraction.

I want every chip P0 has left, and the only way to guarantee that is to put him in himself. Option 1—‘call 360’—would pot-commit me and cost 360 chips now and 220 more when he inevitably fires the rest on river, but the rules don’t allow Vegas-style cheap-dog calling intended to induce a shove later; I must match his bet first. Going all-in immediately just saves time and accomplishes the exact same purpose: it forces P0 to risk his last 220.

For that reason I’ll move in.

[Call]
